If you want cheap food for with friendly customer service then this is the place to be.

Tired of when the dining environment becomes overcast with many restaurants charging so much for so little? If so, there is a rainbow at the end of the overcast dining environment. 

   The Rainbow Club has been a downtown Henderson institution since 1984 when the Peppermill Group brought it. For over thirty years, the Rainbow Club has been serving quality food at old school prices. 

   Oftentimes, good things come in small packages. The Rainbow Club is an infinitesimal property that fits into a small downtown Henderson block. It is primarily a casino, bar, and restaurant. The best way to describe the Rainbow Club is as three long rectangles. The casino is one rectangle. The long bar in the center is the second rectangle. And the long and skinny restaurant in the back, which is Images is the third rectangle. Images (the only restaurant) with its long and skinny layout reminds me of a railroad dining car. 

   Over a couple of handful of times recently, I have dined in the Rainbow Club. I would experience four different items from the menu: 1) chicken parmesan with pasta, 2) meat loaf, 3) chicken fettuccine, 4) and Cajun chicken pasta. Every single one of these dishes exemplified a fantastic deal. The highest price is  $7.75. Where else in Vegas can you enjoy a chicken parmesan dinner for $7.75? The Rainbow gives a large portion. I remember last visit, bringing half of the chicken fettuccine home. The food that they give so much of is quality. At the Rainbow quantity equals quality. With the entre, the Rainbow includes either a soup or salad. One weakness in regards to the salad is there is a want for tomatoes. At the Rainbow, the service has also been right on. 

  The Rainbow may not be a gold rush to gamblers, but it is a mellow place to play at the bar. Several monitors hang over the long bar that turns the place into a professional sports entertainment center. The place comes alive during the NFL games. Just like the food, the drink prices are old school. $1.75 for a bottle of Budweiser is a gold rush for beer drinkers. As far as video Keno, they seem to target the nickel domination over quarters. Mellowed out after a tasty inexpensive meal that followed an outdoor adventure, I enjoyed quaffing a beer while looking up at the professional sports game, looking down at the dime Caveman Keno that kept my money in action and listening to the oldies and locals joke with the bartender. 

  If you want to experience one of the greatest restaurant values in town, then just follow the Rainbow.

I would love to give this a high review for the most part. I will first state, that had we not been with family that really wanted to go there is would have left. An hour wait, then another 45 minutes sitting at the table waiting for food.....not to mention the gambling waiting room filled with smoke...blech.
Now, I do get that smoking is always in a lot of these places. Ok fine. At least no smoking in the actual food area.
So, once we got to the food, it's actually pretty good. They did over cooked my steak. I wasn't going to send it back and wait another 45 minutes for food. The skies were good. The burgers got great reviews from the others at our table. 
I guess one of the biggest surprise draws to this off the beaten path, for locals is the price. You can't be the prices on this menu! !go look at the photos I added from here. You'll see what mean.

I'd at half the experience was good, bad, and ugly.

The good:  the service staff and our waitress were very friendly and efficient. Clam chowder soup was tasty. Onion rings were crisp and hefty sized.  The flat iron steak and the T-bone steak were cooked exactly to our order.  The food prices were super affordable. Portions were large. 

The bad:  The food was WAY TOO SALTY.  The corn on the cob was super soggy.   There were not many parking spots available at the premises.  The casino next to this restaurant was super smoky. 

The ugly:  whatever you do, DO NOT ORDER THE CHICKEN FRIED STEAK. The texture was like crumbled and grounded mishmash of stuff you can't recognize.  It was hidden in a bucketful of store bought gravy that was super salty and tasted like it came out of a can.

For me, it was one and done. I give kudos to the service and portion size 
, but I don't think I can handle again this amount of salt in my food.  Whoever created that chicken fried steak recipe needs to be fired from the place.

Don't judge a book by its cover or a casino by it's outer wall. Because tucked away inside the Rainbow Club in the back of a dark, slightly smokey smelling casino is a restaurant with a seriously good and very reasonably priced menu. 

$6 Denver Omelets! And they are freakin huge!

The decor is changing as the restaurant is remodeling. The rest of the casino while kind of smelly has a great bar with lots of big screens and good bartenders, and they have a nice mix of various slots to chose from. On the down side the restrooms are...in need of a remodel to put it nicely. But Peppermill knows how to make great food, and if you are in Downtown Henderson you would doing yourself a big disservice to skip this place especially if you're hungry. Parking can kinda suck,  but the short walk is worth it, and the wait even on a Sunday morning for breakfast is not that long. 

The Ortega Chile Omelet is another favorite I have to recommend. And the service...the wait staff knows their stuff. Some of the older wait staff can come across with an attitude at first, but if you treat them with respect you get the same and a smile at the end. The younger wait staff has ALWAYS provided service with a smile without fail. As I sit here writing this I'm already looking forward to this weekend and going out for breakfast with family and friends again at the Rainbow Club. 

4 Strong Stars, leaning towards 5..it's close. Rainbow is Peppermill owned and Peppermill treats people right or at least me and my family love the place. 

(Yelp 100 in 2013 Challenge #28)

We had two breakfasts at this popular cafe inside the Rainbow Club in downtown Henderson during our 2 week vacation.  Expect a line during peak dining hours, but in our experience the wait has only been a few minutes.  The wait staff is very efficient so we were soon provided menus and our requested ice water and a coffee for my wife.  On each of our visits we ordered the $1.99 casino special of easy over eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast.  The eggs have been a little underdone both times, but otherwise no complaints.  On our second visit I was admonished first by a waitress and then by a security guard for taking photos.

This is one of the best local Casinos in all of the Metro Las Vegas area. In fact, it is my favorite for a few reasons. Their staff is always friendly, their machines are loose with low denominations, their comp policy (on drinks) is ludicrously lenient, and they have an amazing restaurant. A note on the restaurant: It is actually called Images, though many people are reviewing it here in this Yelp establishment entry. I will be reviewing the Casino as a whole here, so if you want to read my review on Images please look it up.

This Casino has a lot going for it. Their machines have incredible payouts, even on the lowest denominations, For example, their payouts on Keno are better than 90% of the Casinos and Bars in town at a quarter level. Almost everyplace lowers their payouts for lower denominations, but not here. Their penny keno pays better than most of the other gambling establishments in town, and that's unheard of! This is the only place I have ever found anywhere that does this.

On top of that, they comp drinks at an average bet of .20 cents. That's amazing! Almost everywhere wants you to average a $1 a bet, though to be fair, most bartenders at locals places will comp you at lower play as long as your tipping, which I always do. Anyway, if you want plenty of complimentary drinks, take a seat at the bar, start playing some low stakes game, and tip for every drink.

This place isn't perfect though. Their players club is pretty stingy and seems to never off free play. It also seems like you earn comp dollars for the restaurant at a very slow pace. They don't have draft beer and their bottle selection is your usual list of domestics and the most popular foreign. The only other negative is that there are a lot of smokers here (most small locals Casinos are like that), but they have air purifiers everywhere. My wife is very sensitive to smoke and it doesn't bother her here unless a smoker sits right besides here.

Still, these criticisms are very minor and the overall value of this place more than makes up for it. As mentioned earlier, their restaurant is fantastic and is has amazingly low prices. I don't think there is another Casino in town that gives you more bang for your buck. If you want a low budget Casino night, there is no place better, and even if you aren't watching your budget, this place is great.

Henderson, Nevada ---

Day 99 "DUSA Tour 2016" 

"Images" in the Rainbow Casino is the place to eat whenever near Henderson 

If there is a better breakfast deal in the USA, "Run-A-Way Bill" has not experienced it ...

$1.99 (until 11am Mon-Fri) / $2.25 on Sat & Sun gets you 2 eggs (ur way), bacon or sausage, toast OR biscuit & gravy, plus incredibly great service 

$5.25 lunch deals too 

a "Run-A-Way Bill" Favorite place to eat 

#RunAwayBill #DUSATour2016 #LivingLarge 

"Run-A-Way Bill" was here!  
08.19.16

I have to say I was MORE then displeased about the service last night at the host stand. 

This was Friday 1/30/2015 at 5:30pm We were told it would be 25min wait and we were fine with that because the food is so amazingly good everything time. But that 25min wait turned into a total of 1hr and 15min because every time we checked on the status they kept tacking on 20min and the expression on the girls face said it all. Not even an apology presented.

We will NOT be going back to our weekly family stop for a while due to this horrible service.

I was craving a yummy breakfast close to Henderson but away from the chain restaurants like IHOP and Denny's or any buffet. I was looking for something local and good and I remember I had bookmarked Rainbow Club & Casino after reading that there was a dinner inside that served really decent food.

Located on Water Street in downtown Henderson it was close to home and easy to find. The casino was small, very local and quaint. The dinner is located towards the back but there is not much walking to do as the place is not very large. The restaurant is called Images. The staff is very friendly. We were seated right away, it was around 8am and the place was packed. By the time we left there was people waiting in line waiting to get in, I don't blame them...it's worth the wait!

I couldn't believe my eyes when I looked at the menu. Breakfast Casino   specials starting at $1.89!!! There are $5 lunch special with soup or salad and half sandwiches. Dinners specials every day for less than $8  like juicy Prime Rib on Tuesdays and Saturdays and Steak and Shrimp on Wednesdays. This occasion I was craving the NY Steak and Eggs for only $6.25!!! It was delicious, it came with hash browns and my choice of toast or biscuits.

The food was amazing, the prices you couldn't beat, the staff was super quick and friendly and the restaurant was clean and amazingly I didn't get a headache from excessive cigarette smoke. I will definitely be coming back to try out their other specials :)

The Restaurant at the Rainbow Club offers some awesome value.  Flipping through the lunch menu, nothing seemed to be over $7.00.  Soups, salad sandwiches, everything was nice and affordable.

I'm normally not in this part of town, but a training seminar had me out at a training room inside the Wells Fargo on Water street.  Being lazy and not wanting to drive, I walked across to the Rainbow Club.  I got the cajun chicken sandwich with a side of potato salad for roughly $7.00.  And it's a good sized lunch too!  The cajun chicken had an awesome seasoning, with a good spiced flavor.  It also wasn't overseasoned to the point of tasting salty.

The next day I came back here for lunch, this time for a cajun chicken salad; I liked the chicken that much.  What's interesting is that the menu says the chicken is cooked fresh and hot, then added to the salad.  They weren't joking; the top of the salad was sprinkled with cheese, and all the cheese under the chicken had melted.  Chicken was as tasty as the previous visit, and the salad was large enough that I didn't finish it!  It came with tomato, cucumber, cheese and your choice of dressing.

If I'm ever in this part of town, I know that Rainbow Club can deliver a quality lunch ar a good value!

The restaurant is really good especially the prices, if you get there right at opening time be prepared for an old people stampede. The only bad thing was the stink of cigarettes when you walk into the casino. We've had the same waitress and she was great cause we're not  in a hurry when we go there because there were tons of people right at opening time, some of the people do not have patience and I just wish they would open their eyes see that the wait staff is hopping and jumping with all the old people, assholes, workers and gamblers that come in first thing. For the price this place is great we have not had anything bad yet.

Came to the Cafe for Breakfast on recommendation from a work friend. Old school kitschy place like all the best hole-in-the-wall joints. I didn't realize this was a Peppermill Property though! 

Hostesses greet & seat. Decor is very 70's. My 67 yr old father loved the moving picture screen with all the lovely nature scenes. :)

Our server, Tabatha, was very pleasant & prompt. She told us about the 7a-11a breakfast special. 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, hash browns, and your choice of toast or biscuits & gravy for $1.99!!! Coffee was strong. And the food was out before we knew it! All in all a very solid experience! We will definitely be back...Thanks Rainbow Club!

I used to love this place. now, not so much. they ARE very busy and the staff seems irritated to serve you. PLUS i could NOT even get a scoop of tuna cause it was not 11am yet. It was 10:45 and they said no. I suggest you sit at the counter to get a smile and ur food fast.

Cute little casino that Grandma took us too for breakfast.  And wow, was the food cheap.  For the 3 of us $20 for breakfast.  That's one reason I love Vega$, the cheapness factor.  I had a waffle with strawberries and my fiancé had the pork chop breakfast.  It was huge.  2 huge pork chops, eggs, hash browns, and biscuit and gravy.  The food was pretty good too, and this place was packed.  I will definitely go here again on the next trip.  I noticed in the menu they had a breakfast special for $1.99, but it was over at 11.  The casino was nice too, clean, lots of locals.  I didn't win anything here either, but I had fun, and that is all that matters.

Not bad at all!!!!

The restaurant inside is called The Peppermill and the prime rib special for $8.99....... So good!!!!!

The casino itself is old school, looks like something from the late 60's. It's seriously from a time capsule. The service was awesome. Carol and Sandra rule. A hidden gem outside of Vegas.

It has been awhile since anyone wrote about this place so I thought I'd chime in.  We used to frequent this place but have not been here in awhile.  We stopped for a late nite breakfast since we were in the mood for an omelette. 

I usually go for the veggie omellete, heavy on the spinach and veggies, hold the sour cream and light on the cheese.  My favorite.  I tried that same order last night, and while what I got was pretty good, it was, well ahhhh, not an omellete.  

Aren't omellete's supposed to be folded?

First off instead of light cheese there was none.  The spinach used to be stuffed to the hilt.  What I found were a few flecks.  Some little cut up peppers kept the spinach company though so things were looking up.  There was also a smattering of tomato to round out the chorus.  All in all it was mostly egg, and veggies thrown in seemingly as an afterthought.  The cook must have been sleepy or something as the omellete looked like it had taken a ride in the blender on the way to the plate.

Maybe he thought I ordered the veggie smoothie.

Still it was tasty and worth the price.  Maybe this was just a one time foul up.  I hope the next visit they are back in the veggie omellete making form that we came to know and look forward to!

Oh yeah Rainbow, fix your moving picture displays.  Three out of four  that we were next to were not moving.  Maybe they ate one to many omelletes.

Open 24 hours. The cafe is called Images & located in the back. Old school feel & look to it all. 2nd hand smoke galore.

My fiance and I went there because I was craving liver and she found out that they are one of the few places which still serve it. I was not disappointed. Bonus!: the french dip she ordered was A-mazing.

Their service was fantastic as well. Our waitress, Christina, took pride in her work and paid close attention to detail. We even noticed her send a few dishes back to the cooks because they weren't to her standard.

We can't wait to go back to experience this hidden jewel again.  I'm thinking: late night slice of pie and coffee at their counter. How about that?!?
veggie scramble rocks , and gravy all the way ......... thanks rainbow for value and taste .

I have to say this was a great find! If I hadn't read the reviews I would of never went in. Besides the smoke in the casino it was well worth the 25 min wait. Tip, ask for a booth you get seated much faster. The Prime Rib was fantastic and at the regular price it is still a bargain at $11.50 for the thick cut. Tuesday and Saturdays it is on special. When I'm in Henderson I will definitely be back!!

A nice option in the Historic Water Street District of Henderson, where other restaurants unfortunately tend to come & go.

I'm still somewhat new to Henderson & enjoy exploring my city.  the Water St District has a lot of history to it, but despite the city's efforts, past history is mostly what you see -- closed down storefronts awaiting redevelopment.

  I wandered into the Rainbow Club out of curiosity.  I expected it to be old, dimly lit & dirty inside, smelling like cheap booze & stale cigarettes.   I am very pleased to report that my stereotype of the interior was completely wrong!  It's clean & relatively modern inside.  The one thing I guessed correctly about was the clientele -- mostly chain-smoking local retirees, plus a few younger people who perhaps wandered inside to escape the Summer heat.   no table games, just the electronic slot machine types (I don't gamble).

After wandering around, I went to the restaurant.  It was 5:30PM, and all the tables were taken (old people eat early...) but I opted to sit at the counter.   Service was great, food was quick, plentiful & good -- all in all a very good deal for the $$.  An iced tea (free refills), potato skins appetizer, & big bowl of spaghetti marinara with side-salad & garlic bread was a little over $13.

Sitting at the counter, it's a fascinating show to watch & hear the staff interact with each other.   I got to overhear one waitress complain to another about a very high-maintenance table, the waitstaff joke with the line cooks, etc.   organized chaos, but they operated very well together.

If you're on or near Water Street & are hungry, I recommend the restaurant.  It's not really a 'destination' that I'm going to drive a ways just to eat at, but I have no problem recommending it to anyone in the area looking for a cafe type of place.  Remember though, it's not a 24/7 joint.

We went to try the Prime Rib as it was inexpensive. I thought it was ok. My husband wouldnt eat his and he loves Meat. He got sick later in night as well. The place is a total dive locals spot. It is not really for me.. Not trendy, hipster or cool in any way. Primarily lots of old people playing old casino games and hitting up the restrauant after.

Still love this spot for breakfast, lunch or dinner. 

We have tried several menu items here at the Rainbow Club and everything is always tasty. Some of my favorite things to order are like I said in my original review the Country Fried Steak & eggs with their most delicious biscuits & gravy. For lunch I love the Turkey Deluxe which has tons of turkey, tomatoes and cheese all grilled on sourdough. I wish they would let you substitute a side salad for one of their other side options. The Chef Salad is also my favorite item to order for lunch. Great if your trying to low carb it. It's piled high with meat and cheese. It comes with orange slices, which I find odd. Lol For dinner my absolute favorite thing to order is the regular cut Prime Rib! Yummy! It's cooked perfectly and so tender you can cut it with a fork. It comes with choice of potato and veggie. Plus, soup or salad. I love that they give you au jus to dip the meat in and sour cream mixed with horseradish. It gives it the perfect kick! 
If your just looking for a snack or a super cheap appetizer check the menu out of their onion rings. They are super cheap and you get a ton of them. Also, the nachos! Oh the nachos!! The plate comes piled high with chips nacho cheese and jalapeños! They even layer it so that ALL the chips have cheese. 
One sad thing is Rainbow Club is no longer 24 hours and they are usually super busy. So be prepared to wait, but it's totally worth it for the food. The staff is super friendly and on point. 
Yay Rainbow Club! Your still one of my favorite spots in downtown Henderson. Yummy!

I grew up in vegas. Born and raised. I know you don't find them a lot , but I am one of them. We have been coming here for years. As a kid my grandma would take us here to eat she would play keno and we would eat breakfast , she would eat too of course. I would choose a few numbers on occasion. The nostalgia of the black crayons and the smokey casino brings back good memories. Yes it's smokey. Inside the restaurant isn't so bad. That's what this review is for. Since I've been here as a kid. The restraunt has been remodeled. It was years ago so I can't really say if it's improved or declined since then. We were in the area so I decided to bring my boyfriend here for breakfast since we were starving ! 


The restraunt itself is called Images. A sister Restraunt owned by Peppermill. Basically another branch. Everything on the menu is fairly priced under $10. The boyfriend had a Huge country fried steak and eggs with hash browns  for $6 and some change. Comes with toast or biscuits and gravy. More like gravy with a biscuit. Way too much gravy but that's ok. We just ate the biscuits and left the pool of gravy. I had the country Skillet which I enjoyed. Round scrambled egg with tomato , potato sausage and onion inside topped with melted cheese and green onion. Very good. We spent a little over $12 bucks for this meal and were completely stuffed with leftovers to take home ! Our server was super friendly. I dont remember the food As a kid so we will be back to try some more of the menu. Everything that came out was generously portioned and looked really tasty.We came starving and left satisfied. In old Hendertucky this place is a gem.
ahhhh-mazing food for an amazingly affordable price! we like to come here for breakfast, but anytime of day is good. their prime rib is fantastic. they have the best breakfast ever.

Seriously?  These 4 star reviews are really making me question Yelps validity!

We got to this smokey casino and were told it would be a 20 minute wait that was almost double that!  After we were seated there was no smoke, thankfully, but there were certainly a lot of empty tables!

My wife joked that maybe they were making us wait so that we could go gamble because she saw people being seated yet nobody leaving the restaurant!  When we got into the restaurant, I realized that her "joke" was probably not a joke after all because there was plenty of seating....and also plenty of people waiting outside.  That was really irritating to me.

I know this review is focusing on the experience and not food.  Ambience and service is just as important for a customer as the food so I think this is a valid review that should be read.  Cheap prices don't justify the smokey waiting area with fake wait times.  F- for integrity.

We (my family and I) have been going to the Rainbow for over 20 years.  This is a locals establishment where everybody knows your name.  The people are amazing the the service is great.  Unfortunately the management recently changed the restaurant hours.  They are no longer open for breakfast opening at 11am instead of 6am and close at 9pm, but quit taking names by 8pm.  The food is great, the casino employees are amazing, love them all, very friendly and quick service.  This has been a great little gettaway.  Unfortunately I won't be going back like I used to and many other locals feel the same way. It's going to be hard to find another location like this one.  No one is happy anymore.

The food is good, cheap and there are no frills here. My parents live in Henderson and have taken us here a few times. It is certainly not a tourist place to seek out but it could be. 

I know we have eaten here a few time and the food never disappoints.

This place is super divey but totally awesome. You can play the games here with better odds than on the strip and get stiff drinks and cheap food. What more do you need?!

And if it is your thing you can smoke in here too, unless they changed that.

We came here on a Tuesday morning and order 2 casino specials for $5

- The restaurant in Rainbow is called Images 
- Breakfast specials served from 6-11am. As long as you are on the waiting list before 11, you can still order from the special menu! 
- 15min wait around smokers can be a bit irritating, but can't blame them. 
- Casino special is the same as El Dorado's Cafe and Grand Cafe's midnight special, 2 eggs, choice of 2 sausage or bacon, hash brown, and choice of biscuit with gravy or buttered toast. 
- Hash browns are very crispy here! 
- Service is very quick! We got our food in about 5-10min. Great job Lacie. 
- If you want to order another Casino special for yourself, it's 2.89! Haha..
- Prices are actually more expensive here than El Dorado, gotta love the 4 deuces there. At Images, it's 4.25!

Food is good, plentiful and the price is fairly inexpensive. The decor is a little 70's ish. Looks a little like an older funeral home inside. The giant silk flower arrangements need to go. I think the flowers take away from the Rat Pack charm the place has. Service was good. It's a little loud inside. You can hear everyone around you talk. Some more than others.  We will go again. Great deals and good food.

Went to the restaurant here with a few of my gal pals for a later dinner, and really enjoyed the experience.  All of the servers and staff members I interacted with were very friendly and courteous.  I had the tostada salad, and it was very yummy.  I wish there were more vegetarian options, but if I come back here I'll be happy to have that same salad again or one of the other couple of meals.  Prices are great, too!

While the neon is a trip to the 70's, the food, prices, and service cannot be beat.  There is NOTHING over $11.00 on the menu.  Breakfast, lunch, and dinner (closes at 10pm)  The food is the SAME as The Peppermill on Las Vegas Blvd. and in Reno.  They don't have the super gigantic portions, but I guarantee you won't leave hungry.  They have lunch, and dinner specials daily.  I have been a customer here for years, and always have a great experience.  The staff works very hard, and is always friendly.  It is worth the drive!

Amazing food at great prices.  It's become a favorite in such a short time because it is so close to my apt.  Just a greasy spoon with endless amounts of coffee if you need it.  My waffle was a little late the last time we went so my meal was comped.  I didn't even complain but the manager must have seen the ticket time and the fact the other people in my party already had their food.  It was an delicious waffle.  The tuna melt is to die for and the make your own burger is a mouthful of goodness.  What I love about this place is that it is very busy but yet everyone that works there is always on it.  It's not the whole, "well, that's not my table so why should I bother."  Collectively its everyone's table.

Stopped thru the "ol skool"spot for a Sunday breakfast and had the western w toast n hash browns. Never been disappointed, and today was no exception. Good service w Kelli and coffee helped me wake up also! Great way to start the day on any day not just Sunday. Omelet was made to perfection. The crew here was on point today!! Thanks for the great start to the day..

How did I ever forget about this place ?

No you are not going to get gourmet food.

What you will get is good, basic food and plenty of it.

Prime rib for me, it actually didn't look that great, but the first bite confirmed it was good, no strike that is was fantastic, one of the best slices of prime rib I have eaten, melt in your mouth good.

Pot roast for the wife, she was very happy with it, i'm not a fan of pot roast, so it's not fair for me to judge.

All in all, great meal, silly cheap prices (I would have been happy paying double for the meal) service was good, place is clean, certainly one to visit again.

This review is for images restaurant. I've been here in the past and it was always affordable quick and tasty. This last time it seemed not quite up to par. The waitressing to forget about me once or twice and the food just seemed a little less love in the preparation. I'm I'm not giving up when I travel through Vegas I will hit this one again and give it another shot but hope they can get back up to the a friendly atmosphere and good food on a custom to you. I do wish that the booth had more seating room they're very tight.

The food was excellent, the prices fantastic, the restaurant itself was nice and clean, also the waitress was nice...BUT the host was terrible and the busboy was worse. Horrible attitude and a smart Alec, don't even dare to ask any of them to remove a plate or anything else, we were in fear of getting beaten up, so let the dishes pile up and enjoy the prime rib. Its worth the abuse.

We have been going here for quite awhile now. This place is truly a diamond in the rough. "Images" has good food for great prices, the casino special is a morning ritual on the weekend for us. Casino special comes with two eggs, bacon or sausage, and hash browns or home fries all for a really low price. The portions and pricing you just can't beat. 

Pros: friendly staff, portions of food, pricing

Cons: small restaurant, can get crowded easily 

Tip: it gets busy around the weekends so there might be a waiting list but the bar counter top is open seating and you can grab food up there too!

I do not live anyway close to Rainbow's casino. But I drive by it at least once a week cuz I'm always heading to the lakes to
Dive. And this one awesome place to eat after a dive! Food is cheap and freaking good.

excellant......staff wonderful, food really great, prices right, reminfs of old timer diner with friendliness and athmosphere....had the super breakfast and did add ons to build my check.   the ham was a whole slice of ham. and another day i ordered french toast beside breakfast special.    everything was outstanding. well definitely be back.   dinner specials sound wonderful and for the price.   see you in the spring.....thanks again gang
Can't go wrong here!  Great price with excellent service.   Everything on the menu is delicious.

The corned beef and cabbage is OEDIBLE. Not the best. The corned beef is very dry, the cabbage is squishy ( I like it though) and the potatoes are very bland and tasteless. Avoid.

"Drafted on 3/17/2012, for a St. Patrick's Day meal"
Very dishonest and poor people casino: sent me a flyer but refused to give my gift. No rain-check nor make-ups.I will never give my money to this casino, nor go there anymore.

We tried this for the first time for the Tuesday prime rib special.  Salad was simple with fresh ranch dressing. Then came a standard baked potato and corn with the prime rib. The outside was seasoned perfectly.  Both my husband and I enjoyed it, especially at the $8.50 price. My son had an omelet, which came with hash browns, and biscuit and gravy. It was also delicious. Will definitely come again. You do have to walk through the smoky smelling casino but the restaurant was smoke free.

Stopped in for some of the biscuits and gravy I have been reading about at their Cafe. Have to admit, the value is amazing for them! The food was good and the service wasn't too shabby either. 

The cafe's decor was surprisingly updated and interesting. The photo slideshows showing on screens throughout the restaurant livened up a casino cafe.

Time to update my review since the cafe (Images) remodeled awhile back and is much nicer.....

The old cafe looked similar to the Peppermill Lounge on Las Vegas Blvd - with bright colors and neon lights.  They've recently (within the last year - I'm behind on updates) remodeled the entire place.  The decor is much more neutral and modern and quite a few of the tvs were removed (sad).

The prices have gone up about $1 per meal, but are still impossible to beat.  I had a porterhouse special on a Tuesday night, and at $7.99 (with a salad or soup and a baked potato) it was one of the best steaks I've ever had.  Never thought I'd say that about this place!

It's a small place, located in a small casino and it gets crowded on evenings, weekends and holidays.  Lots of locals love this place, so be prepared to wait for a table at peak times.

The service has always been friendly and prompt and they have a lot of servers in the room so that nobody is overwhelmed by tables.

If you find yourself near Downtown Henderson, stop in and give Images a try.

I went there because of all the high ratings it got.  And this place is a prime example where the rating is really deceptive.  I tried what most people suggested...the prime rib.  Well...it was the weirdest (not bad, but weird) cut I ever tasted.  It LOOKED like prime rib...but it tasted exactly like corned beef.  Like, I think the beef was actually put in water at some point.  The peas and carrots must have been left soaking from the morning...HORRIBLE.   The stars, ironically, are coming for the service which many have knocked.  I guess I got one of the better waitresses that day, but at least she salvaged my experience.  Also, I saw some other people ordering plates like chicken fingers which looked ok.  The prices are pretty good, and I would actually give this place a second chance because I think if I go with a simpler dish, I might leave happier.  

I love dives, and as far as prime rib, Longhorn remains my fave, but for now, Rainbow gets 2 stars from me.

For the price, no one can beat it!   The menu offers variety, a daily special, and great prices. Service has always been quick and friendly.  Food is great...where else can two people eat for $15 or less...?

I come here every time I've visited Las Vegas. I come for the breakfasts which are really good for what the cost is. The flavor is really good. The wait kinda sucks but you get to play on the slots while you wait for your table to be called.

OMG....Had the $10 Prime Rib Special, came with baked potato, vegetables and salad, was soooooo good! The piece of meat was huge, couldn't believe the size. Very reasonable prices for everything on the menu. Looking forward to going back.
Your prices have all gone up and the breakfast early bird menu is gone.  This restaurant is not that special now.  Very disappointed.

One of my absolute favorite places in the valley. The service, food, drinks, and bar staff are on point! The atmosphere is retro-perfect, and the prices are so good you couldn't make the food at home for the same money. The prime rib is excellent, especially if you request the end piece! This place is first class all the way!

Eat here quite often. Sometimes it's great other times its terrible. On a good day the food is excellent and the best you will find for it's price. Other times nothing is cooked the way you ordered it and/or it's cold. Have had more positive experience than negative. Figured 3 to 3 1/2 stars is about the average for the many times I have eaten here over the past few years

We ended up here based on the high star rating for the food. Upon arriving, it is clear this is a favorite for the locals. If you're expecting a large glamorous casino like those on the strip, go to the strip. 

This place is a step back in time. The air is smokey, there are Rainbow regulars, and a good number of elderly. If you sit at the bar and play (I think $0.20) you will get a complimentary drink. 

Anyway, we went for the food. It was nothing spectacular, but basic. I got a chicken quesadilla and my husband got a turkey sandwich for lunch. These were items that you could easily and quickly assemble in your own kitchen and have it taste the same. I'd say it was standard portion sizes, definitely not too much, at a very economical price. We both ate for under $14. If you're looking to save money and splurge on other meals, this could be your place.
Smokey and old but for under $2.00 you get a good breakfast and in my opinion the food quality is what you would find at Denny's or Ihop

This place is such a hidden gem of Henderson. 

If you're not a local, you probably don't even know this exists. But it does and I'm glad! I've been coming here since I was younger, and nothing beats the prices! The quality actually isn't too bad. Their food is delish and cheap. What more could someone ask?

I love their strawberry waffle!! It's drenched in whipped cream and strawberries though, and if you're not a LOVER of whipped cream I wouldn't dare try it. But it is super yummy! I also think they have one of the best french toasts in town! They give you a slab of butter and thick syrup that just makes the french toast so fluffy and perfect texture! A must try.

I've had their club sandwich which is HUGE and tasty!

Their casino special can't be beat.
6:00am-11:00am so you must be early!
But it's $1.89. Tell me, where else can that be beat??!
It comes with hash browns, bacon or sausage, eggs, and toast or biscuits and gravy.
Whaaaat a DEAL!!!!!!

Customer service is friendly and always accommodating.
It's a small diner so it can get pretty busy.
But worth the trip! If you're in Henderson, MUST TRY!

It's strip-club-tastic. The neon / mirrors motif is pretty awesome, but you definitely don't want the waitresses to be giving you lap dances.  The gals who wait on you look like old diner movie cliches. They all look like "Maude"s or "Harriet"s.

The food here is good old diner food. Sub Denny's prices, and way better than Denny's quality. Most of the stuff on the menu will shorten your life, but walking through the haze to get to the restaurant takes 10 years away anyhow. My wife thinks the potato skins are awesome, I don't understand the big deal. I think it's more about nostalgia for her. I don't mind going because the prices are great.
Amazing casino special breakfast! I always come here multiple times whenever I visit Henderson.

Worst casino management in Henderson, Nevada. I use to praise them on their restaurant but now they seem to be racist company. They allowed a waitress to work there and last night this waitress accused me and a friend who is a business owner of motel down the street of trying to get over with a slice a pie which he purchased a pie and we split it. That was racial profiling which in Henderson that happens very often. Other than that their restaurant is not a good place to eat if you have a strict diet of no pork. That contributes to high blood pressure. I personally don't eat red meat or beef anymore. The cheap breakfast doesn't provide an alternative like Denny's does.

Images The Restaurant is a surprising gem hidden inside the Rainbow Club. My wife found the restaurant and said let's go. We arrived at the casino, and at first I was confused. Once we walked through the casino, it all made sense. The food and service were great. My wife and I are both from the restaurant industry in California, so we know how to look at a restaurant from an insiders perspective. 

Pricing?! Can't be beat! (The business math is simple with the casino offset.) The service was great and the staff was as well. Glad we found this place. Next time were in Las Vegas, or Henderson, we'll make a point to return.

The food is great but the people working there are terrible.  It's very clicky.  If you aren't from Pitman you get treated like crap.  Everyone is beyond rude and acts like you are putting them out to do their job.  The casino is overrun with cigarette smoke and the wait is always over 40 mins.
Good food at a reasonable prices. Note that they have New Hours.. They open at 11am, the times posted are incorrect.

I strolled along Water St to finally enter this itty bitty casino at the heart of Downtown Henderson.  It's bigger than a Dotty's but smaller than a Fitzgerald's.  However, gambling wasn't on my mind, it was coffee shop grub and I was hoping they would deliver the goods on a Hot Turkey sandwich or a Blue Plate special of some sort made from the remnants of the Blue Plate special that wasn't sold the day before.

The hostess was real friendly greeting me at the door.  The dining space was spacious but felt very similar to one of those roadside diners that you might see on a long trip or in a half-lighted neon poster with Bogart, Dean, and Monroe.  Yeah, that kind of joint.

I sat down at a very clean table with menu in hand and already a comment card given to me by the hostess.  Now that's a way to ensure everyone is always on notice to bring your A-game.  I asked about the special and they didn't have anything that sounded appetizing or mysterious or challengin to digest so I passed.  I instead ordered my guilty pleasure, the Open Faced Hot Turkey Sandwich with Mashed Potatoes and a Diet Coke.  Crystal was very friendly taking my order and she told me her name, I didn't have to glance-snatch it off a name badge.  The food was yum to my tum and the her busperson was equally as friendly clearing my table and inquiring on re-fills.  

I like the food and the service.  I knocked it down one star because you have traverse the small casino floor which like all casinos is drenched with the smell of smoke soaked carpets and littered with tripping hazards like Oxygen tanks and the people attached to them.  Seriously, I'm not keen on taking that smell out with me but it's inevitable.  The exchange is that I got a great hot turkey sandwich and the world seems a tad brighter like the Wizard just gave me cuh-rij.  Recommended.
